title: Suggestions for a sans-serif to work with Baskerville
content: hello, just wondered what sans-serif people would suggest for working well with Baskerville (reg and italic) in a brand identity. thanks.
author: do

comments.content: What are three adjectives that describe your brand?
contemporary but established, urban but caring
Personally I like Syntax with Baskers.

[John Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043911/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-23-john-sans) is a sans cut of Baskerville by Stormtype. It goes well with his [Baskerville Original](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043911/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-22-baskerville-original). Check them out, I think they are just fantastic.

_contemporary but established, urban but caring_

Corporate but friendly? Quality but affordable?  
Thou doth protest too much, methinks.

More to the point, which Baskerville?

Bureau Eagle  
ITC Franklin Gothic  
Futura  
Trade Gothic
